itemDescription: Archer, Georgina (1827–1882), promoter of women's education

wikipedia_page.main: Georgiana Archer (27 September 1827 – 18 November 1882) was a German (originally Scottish) women's rights activist and educator. She played a significant part in the history of women's education in Germany. She is known as the founder of the Victoria-Lyzeum in Berlin (1869). This institution went on to prepare female students for university studies.
